concise_definition: v. 取消, 废止, 抵消

definitions.explanation_en: To officially annul or terminate a planned event, arrangement, or appointment, rendering it no longer valid or effective.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指正式撤销或终止一项已计划的事件、安排或预约，使其不再有效或具有约束力。
definitions.example_en: The concert was cancelled due to heavy rain and unsafe conditions.
definitions.example_cn: 由于大雨和不安全的状况，音乐会被取消了。

definitions.explanation_en: To counteract or nullify the effect of something, often by an opposing force or action.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过相反的力量或行动抵消某事物的影响或效果。
definitions.example_en: The bonus he received cancelled out the pay cut he had suffered last month.
definitions.example_cn: 他收到的奖金抵消了上个月的工资削减。

definitions.explanation_en: To cross out or mark through something (such as text or a name) to indicate it is invalid or no longer applicable.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用笔划掉（如文字或姓名）以表明其无效或不再适用。
definitions.example_en: She cancelled the old address on the envelope before writing the new one.
definitions.example_cn: 她在信封上划掉旧地址后，写上了新地址。

comparison.analysis: “Cancelled” 是英式英语的标准拼写，而 “canceled” 是美式英语的常见拼写。两者在语义和用法上完全相同，仅属地域拼写差异。在正式写作中，应根据目标读者的地区习惯选择其一。
“Postponed” (推迟) 指将原定事件延后到另一个时间，但并未取消，仍计划执行。而 “cancelled” 表示彻底终止，不再举行或执行。例如：会议被推迟到下周 vs. 会议被取消了。
“Retracted” (撤回) 通常用于正式声明、言论或承诺，强调收回之前发表的内容，常带有道德或法律责任的意味。而 “cancelled” 更广泛用于事件、服务或计划的终止，不必然涉及责任或道歉。
